author: Redazione
title: Jerry Cal√†: "Ho avuto l'onore di girare un film a Napoli ed √® stata una cosa meravigliosa"
text:
[Media](/media/)
Jerry Cal√†: "Ho avuto l'onore di girare un film a Napoli ed √® stata una cosa meravigliosa"
Il noto attore e regista parla del film girato nella citt√† partenopea e dell'infarto avuto proprio durante gli ultimi giorni di lavorazione della pellicola
"Ho avuto l'onore di girare un film a Napoli, l√¨ dove non avevo mai girato un film ed √® stato una cosa meravigliosa. Ho passato un mese e mezzo bellissimo. Ho avuto a disposizione attori fantastici come Sergio Assisi, Nando Paone, Maurizio Casagrande, Barbara Foria. Poi Clementino ha scritto una canzone per i film". Cos√¨ Jerry Cal√†, ospite del programma di Caterina Balivo "La volta buona" in onda su Rai 1, ha parlato del suo nuovo film "
Chi ha rapito Jerry Cal√†?" e del periodo passato nella citt√† partenopea.
"Il film √® molto divertente, l‚Äôidea √® molto originale, anche un po‚Äô folle. Ho cercato di fare una commedia molto realistica e chi ha amato il cinema degli anni ‚Äô80, secondo me, amer√† anche questo mio film. Ho cercato di riportare la leggerezza di quegli anni anche in questa commedia", ha proseguito il noto attore e regista.
Cal√† ha parlato anche
dell'infarto avuto proprio a Napoli negli ultimi giorni di lavorazione del film: "Proprio un paio di giorni prima della fine della lavorazione, tornando a Napoli dal Molise dove ho preso un freddo pazzesco, non so quale sia stato il motivo, forse era una cosa latente, stavo mangiando in camera in albergo e ho sentito una fitta fortissima. Speravo fosse un‚Äôindigestione e invece era un infartino. Adesso ho tre stent. Non perdo occasione per ringraziare la clinica Mediterranea di Napoli e la buona sanit√† che mi ha salvato la vita".

author: heraldscotland.com
title: Liverpool punish rivals' errors with dominant win over Leicester to stretch lead | The Oldham Times
text:
Premier League leaders Liverpool ruthlessly exploited another slip by their title rivals to move seven points clear with a match in hand after a 3-1 win over Leicester.
Chelsea‚Äôs surprise defeat at home to Fulham earlier in the day had been an unexpected gift for Arne Slot‚Äôs side and they drove home their advantage by outclassing the struggling Foxes.
Having overcome the early setback of conceding to Jordan Ayew, with even the travelling fans expressing their surprise they were winning away after taking just five points on the road this season, the home team had too much quality.
Mohamed Salah, second left, celebrates after scoring Liverpool‚Äôs third goal against Leicester (Peter Byrne/PA) That was personified by the excellent Cody Gakpo, whose eighth goal in his last 14 appearances produced the equaliser in first-half added time with the Netherlands international unlucky to have a second ruled out for offside by VAR.
Further goals from Curtis Jones and Mohamed Salah, with his 19th of the season, stretched Liverpool‚Äôs unbeaten run to 22 matches.
For Leicester, who had slipped into the bottom three after Wolves‚Äô win over Manchester United, it is now one win from the last 10 in the league and Ruud van Nistelrooy has plenty of work to do, although he was not helped here by the absence of leading scorer Jamie Vardy through injury.
It looked liked Liverpool meant business from the off with Salah‚Äôs volley from Gakpo‚Äôs far-post cross just being kept out by Jakub Stolarczyk, making his league debut after former Liverpool goalkeeper Danny Ward was omitted from the squad having struggled in the defeat to Wolves.
But if the hosts thought that had set the tone they were badly mistaken after being opened up with such simplicity in only the sixth minute.
Jordan Ayew celebrates after putting Leicester in front (Peter Byrne/PA) Stephy Mavididi broke down the left and his low cross picked out Ayew, who turned Andy Robertson far too easily, with his shot deflecting off Virgil van Dijk to take it just out of Alisson Becker‚Äôs reach.
With a surprise lead to cling to Leicester knew they had to quell the storm heading their way and they began by trying to take as much time out of the game as they could, much to Anfield‚Äôs frustration.
It took a further 18 minutes for Liverpool to threaten with Gakpo cutting in from the left to fire over, a precursor for what was to follow just before half-time.
That was the prompt for the attacks to rain down on the Foxes goal, with Salah‚Äôs shot looping up off Victor Kristiansen and landing on the roof of the net and Robertson heading against a post.
Gakpo‚Äôs inclination to come in off the left was proving a problem for the visitors, doing their utmost to resist the pressure, but when Salah curled a shot onto the crossbar on the stroke of half-time it appeared they had survived.
Cody Gakpo curls in Liverpool‚Äôs first goal (Peter Byrne/PA) However, Gakpo once again drifted in off the flank to collect an Alexis Mac Allister pass before curling what is fast becoming his trademark effort over Stolarczyk and inside the far post.
Early the second half Darwin Nunez fired over Ryan Gravenberch‚Äôs cross before Jones side-footed home Mac Allister‚Äôs cross after an intricate passing move inside the penalty area involving Nunez, Salah and the Argentina international.
Leicester‚Äôs ambition remained limited but Patson Daka should have done better from a two-on-one counter attack with Mavididi but completely missed his kick with the goal looming.
üéØ pic.twitter.com/IqmAsKylLR
‚Äî Liverpool FC (@LFC) December 26, 2024
Nunez forced a save out of the goalkeeper before Gakpo blasted home what he thought was his second only for VAR to rule Nunez was offside in the build-up.
But Liverpool‚Äôs third was eventually delivered by the left foot of Salah, who curled the ball outside Kristiansen, inside Jannick Vestergaard and past Stolarczyk inside the far post.
Sport

author: Carah Hart
title: Farmers glad to see dicamba back in toolbox for 2024
text:
News
Farmers glad to see dicamba back in toolbox for 2024
A director with the American Soybean Association says he‚Äôs pleased the Environmental Protection Agency is allowing farmers to use existing stocks of dicamba for the upcoming growing season.
This week, EPA issued an existing stocks order for dicamba, allowing for its limited use in 2024. The order applies to dicamba that was ‚Äúpackaged, labeled, and released for shipment‚Äù prior to a February 6 ruling that vacated dicamba registration.
Alan Meadows, a western Tennessee farmer, tells Brownfield he uses the herbicide to control weeds in his soybeans and there was uncertainty about the product following a recent court ruling.
‚ÄúIt left a lot of questions here on our farm about exactly how we‚Äôd move forward, what the next steps would be.‚Äù
Meadows says there‚Äôs more clarity now and he‚Äôs not concerned about getting the dicamba supplies he needs.
‚ÄúThere should be plenty of existing stocks as of today, based on how I understand it. That‚Äôs always subject to change, but right now, that‚Äôs how I understand it.‚Äù
Meadows says he‚Äôs looking for more certainty on the future of dicamba use beyond the upcoming growing season so he can make the best product decisions for 2025.
Meadows is an at-large member of the 2024 ASA Executive Committee.

The global aquaculture industry, responsible for nearly half of the world‚Äôs seafood consumption, is poised for significant growth in the coming years. Driven by rising demand for protein, increasing environmental concerns surrounding wild-caught fisheries, and technological advancements, the market is estimated to reach a staggering USD 366.4 billion by 2030, according to a recent report by Market Research Future (MRFR). author: Randy Caluag
title: Dormitorio's golden ride spurs PH bid in Thailand
text:
Filipino cyclist Alexandra ‚ÄúLexi‚Äù Dormitorio of Coach D Racing-Philippines opened the UCI Thailand MTB XCO Cup with a stunning victory, claiming the gold medal in the 13km Women Junior Cross Country event.
The 16-year-old Philippine national champion delivered a dominant performance, crossing the finish line in 50:51‚Äîan impressive eight minutes ahead of her closest rival from Thailand.
‚ÄúThis gold medal win is for you, mabuhay ang Pilipinas!‚Äù Dormitorio shared on social media. ‚ÄúWhen you have a huge number of people all over the world praying or visualizing for you to win, there‚Äôs no way it won‚Äôt manifest, especially if you surrender to God whatever the outcome will be.‚Äù
The rest of the opening day saw Filipino cyclists continue the momentum with more podium finishes.
Adrian Nacario and John Andre Aguja, both representing Go for Gold, secured silver and bronze in the Men‚Äôs Under-23 Cross Country event. Indonesian rider Feri Yudoyuno narrowly edged them out in the 26km race, clocking 1:05:15.1, with Nacario and Aguja finishing at 1:05:15.18 and 1:05:30, respectively.
In the Men‚Äôs Junior category, Thirdy Mana-ay of Go for Gold added a silver medal, completing the 16km race just 50 seconds behind gold medalist Pongaryukun of Thailand.
The opening day concluded with Team Philippines earning an impressive tally of one gold, two silvers, and a bronze.
Shagne Yaoyao of the Philippine national team, Nicole Quinones of Asian TCS Club, and Carl Dela Cruz of Go for Gold are set to compete on Friday in the Women and Men Elite events, aiming to build on their country‚Äôs strong start.

author: FOX 32 Digital Staff
title: Windy City to Wintry City: LEGOLAND replicates snowy Chicago cityscape
text:
SCHAUMBURG, Ill. - Chicagoland will be blanketed in snow on Friday, but LEGOLAND Discovery Center Chicago is already giving us a sneak peek of what we'll see.
The center replicated a snowy Chicago cityscape in its MINILAND experience, capturing what the city will look like after the incoming winter storm.
And, the winter wonderland is made out of over a million LEGO bricks!
LEGOLAND Discovery Center Chicago replicated the snowy Chicago cityscape. Pictured is a snowy scene at O'Hare Airport. ( LEGOLAND Discovery Center Chicago)
From a snowy scene at O'Hare International Airport to a busy city street enveloped in snow, LEGOLAND is giving us a glimpse of the Windy City turned Wintry City.
Snowy Chicago street created by LEGOLAND Discovery Center Chicago. ( LEGOLAND Discovery Center Chicago)
A significant snow storm is heading toward Chicago and is expected to bring several inches of snow on Friday.
Our FOX Model predicts anywhere between 2 and 12 inches of snow by Saturday morning. Heavy amounts of snow are expected west, north and northwest of Chicago.
To keep up with the latest weather updates, follow our weather page here .

author: @infobae
title: Congresista de EEUU y l√≠deres del exilio pidieron la liberaci√≥n de todos los presos pol√≠ticos tras cumplirse tres a√±os del 11J en Cuba - Infobae
text:
Pidieron la liberaci√≥n de todos los presos pol√≠ticos tras cumplirse tres a√±os del 11J en Cuba (EFE/ARCHIVO) Congresistas y organizaciones del exilio cubano en EEUU pidieron este jueves, cuando se cumpli√≥ el tercer aniversario de las hist√≥ricas manifestaciones antigubernamentales del 11J en Cuba , la puesta en libertad de todos los presos pol√≠ticos en la naci√≥n caribe√±a.
Los congresistas republicanos Carlos Gim√©nez y Mar√≠a Elvira Salazar, y sus colegas dem√≥cratas Debbie Wasserman Schultz y Bob Men√©ndez , demandaron hoy la libertad de los m√°s de 1.000 presos pol√≠ticos arrestados ‚Äúpor exigir la libertad del r√©gimen asesino‚Äù.
‚ÄúEl movimiento J11 es una serie de protestas pac√≠ficas en toda la isla de Cuba, que captan la atenci√≥n del mundo, contra el brutal y asesino r√©gimen de Castro y el Partido Comunista de Cuba . El r√©gimen ha respondido con extrema brutalidad‚Äù, record√≥ Gim√©nez, nacido en Cuba.
A su turno, en un comunicado, el Partido Dem√≥crata de Florida rememor√≥ que hace tres a√±os el pueblo cubano tom√≥ las calles en ‚Äúla manifestaci√≥n m√°s grande en d√©cadas‚Äù para demandar la libertad.
‚ÄúDesde el 11 de julio de 2021, el r√©gimen cubano ha mantenido en prisi√≥n a cientos de manifestantes pac√≠ficos y ha continuado sus esfuerzos por silenciar a los cubanos, intimidar a los manifestantes y detener a presos pol√≠ticos‚Äù, dijo la presidenta de los dem√≥cratas de Florida, Nikki Fried .
Fried pidi√≥ la liberaci√≥n de l√≠deres destacados de la oposici√≥n cubana, como Jos√© Daniel Ferrer, Luis Manuel Otero Alc√°ntara, F√©lix Navarro Rodr√≠guez, Pedro Luis Boitel, y su hija Sayl√≠ Navarro, adem√°s de Maikel ‚ÄòEl Osorbo‚Äô, uno de los compositores e int√©rpretes de la canci√≥n ‚ÄòPatria y Vida‚Äô, convertida en himno de las hist√≥ricas marchas.
El 11 de julio de 2021 se registr√≥ una jornada de protestas hist√≥rica en Cuba que dio pie a los continuos reclamos en contra del r√©gimen que se presentan a√∫n en la isla (EFE/ARCHIVO) El senador por Florida Marco Rubio lament√≥ que desde las protestas de hace tres a√±os las cosas ‚Äúse han puesto peor‚Äù en Cuba, no solo por el n√∫mero de presos y las largas condenas, sino por la situaci√≥n ‚Äúdesbaratada‚Äù de la econom√≠a nacional que ha llevado a que un 5 % de su poblaci√≥n haya abandonado la isla.
‚ÄúEl marxismo no funciona, la dictadura no funciona, y est√°n destruyendo un bello pa√≠s que merece la libertad ‚Äù, agreg√≥ el senador, de origen cubano.
El grupo del exilio M.A.R. por Cuba hizo un llamado a los gobiernos democr√°ticos y a la comunidad internacional para que se coloquen del ‚Äúlado de los cubanos que luchan por la patria, la vida y la libertad‚Äù.
Por su parte, la Asamblea de la Resistencia Cubana hizo eco hoy de la carta ‚ÄúNosotros Somos Plantados‚Äù, que tres presos pol√≠ticos cubanos firmaron y sacaron de la prisi√≥n de forma clandestina, y en la que piden al pueblo ‚Äúcontinuar oponi√©ndose a la dictadura dentro y fuera de prisi√≥n‚Äù.
Los firmantes de la misiva, Arianna L√≥pez Roque , y el matrimonio compuesto por Donaida P√©rez Paseiro y Loreto Hern√°ndez Garc√≠a , informaron que se reafirmaron en su condici√≥n de ‚Äúplantados‚Äù tras negarse a participar ‚Äúen el programa de ‚Äòreducaci√≥n‚Äô y ‚Äòadoctrinamiento‚Äô impuesto en las c√°rceles castristas a los que se oponen a la dictadura‚Äù.
Este mismo jueves, la organizaci√≥n Prisoners Defenders (PD) inform√≥ que al cierre de junio llevan contabilizados un total de 1.117 personas encarceladas en Cuba por razones pol√≠ticas, cuatro m√°s que los incluidos en su reporte mensual anterior.
La organizaci√≥n, con sede en Madrid, detall√≥ que en mayo a√±adi√≥ a su listado cinco personas consideradas presas pol√≠ticas y que una sali√≥ del registro tras el cumplimiento √≠ntegro de la pena impuesta.
(Con informaci√≥n de EFE)

author: Di√°rio do Com√©rcio
title: Minas Gerais √© o primeiro no ranking nacional de florestas plantadas
text:
Minas Gerais √© o primeiro no ranking nacional de florestas plantadas
S√£o cerca de 1,3 milh√µes de hectares no Estado e 803 munic√≠pios mineiros t√™m plantio florestal
16 de fevereiro de 2024 √†s 5h12
Minas Gerais ocupa a primeira posi√ß√£o no ranking de florestas plantadas do Brasil com 2.3 milh√µes de hectares. A lideran√ßa dos plantios mineiros representa 24% de toda a base florestal do Brasil. Isso representa quase o dobro da √°rea plantada no estado de S√£o Paulo, o segundo colocado no ranking com 1.2 milh√£o de hectares. Os dados fazem parte de um levantamento in√©dito realizado pela Associa√ß√£o Mineira da Ind√∫stria Florestal (Amif) em parceria com a Ind√∫stria Brasileira de √Årvores (Ib√°) e outras associa√ß√µes estaduais representativas do setor.
Com rela√ß√£o a √°rvores conservadas, s√£o cerca de 1,3 milh√µes de hectares no Estado e 803 munic√≠pios mineiros t√™m plantio florestal, o que representa 94% das cidades de Minas Gerais. Com rela√ß√£o ao plantio de √°rvores em
territ√≥rio mineiro, 96,8% s√£o de eucaliptos.
O eucalipto d√° origem a produtos essenciais para a sociedade desde o carv√£o vegetal amplamente utilizado para a produ√ß√£o de a√ßo, ferro-gusa e ferroligas na ind√∫stria sider√∫rgica ‚Äì sendo uma mat√©ria-prima que tamb√©m solidifica a posi√ß√£o do Estado como
l√≠der mundial em produ√ß√£o e consumo ‚Äì at√© papel e celulose, pain√©is, chapas, pisos laminados, madeira natural, madeira tratada, dentre outros. (Com informa√ß√µes da Amif) PARTICIPE DO NOSSO CANAL NO WHATSAPP
